meanings.definition: To decide or settle in advance
meanings.sent1: She wanted to predetermine the meeting time to avoid any confusion.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will predetermine the seating arrangement for the students.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to predetermine the card the audience would choose.
meanings.sent4: His strict routine seemed to predetermine his success in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The fortune teller claimed to predetermine people's destinies with her crystal ball.

meanings.sent1: The weather forecast can sometimes predetermine our weekend plans.
meanings.sent2: His past experiences seemed to predetermine his future decisions.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient would predetermine the outcome of the dish.
meanings.sent4: The coach's pep talk seemed to predetermine the team's performance in the game.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious prophecy appeared to predetermine the kingdom's fate.
